hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When NEUTRAL regime sees a >3% breakout attempt that fails to hold (closes back within prior range) on above-average volume, and is followed by a lower high within 2 days, the regime will transition to BEAR within 3 days with >60% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts during neutral periods indicate lack of conviction and can trigger reversal patterns. In current regulatory environment (FCA 2027 rollout), failed bullish attempts may reflect underlying caution about implementation timelines.
entry_conditions: BTC has >3% intraday move above recent range
Fails to hold: closes within prior 5-day range
Forms lower high within 2 days of failed breakout

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price successfully breaks above failed breakout high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of failed breakouts lead to consolidation or successful second attempt rather than BEAR transition.
